column4: Hi anyone know why my grub installatio nis throwing up this error: invalid environment block cannot read linux header?
running on hardware raid
I'm able to boot into older version of the kernel but the current throws up this error: invalid environment block cannot read linux header
Is it safe to simply remove the kernel version that is giving me problems?
its the newest kernel which is causing the problems?
this work?
you can remove the newest kernel or boot an older kernel in grub but because of security its not a good idea to run an older patchlevel of the kernel
great, yes
well can i reinstall the latest kernel?
sure
I tried marking them for reinstallation but it did nothing
what package you removed? the metapackage for the kernel or the kernel itself?
marked everything in synaptic with the kernel version that was giving me trouble
ok
that is no problem
it didn't do anything though
sudo apt-get dist-upgrade should offer you again the latest kernel
well i never removed them
